page.title: 06The Square
page.content: The{SQUARE}is protected because it is an example of early village planning and contains many listed buildings. The most dominant of these is the { {BELLIE CHURCH}on the south side. In front of the church is a fountain with park benches along side a large area of lawns and trees. Through the middle of the square runs the{A96}trunk road creating a need for the anciliary bus shelter, public toilets and telephone booths. In the summer of 1985 the shelter was badly affected by graffiti and four senior art pupils created an attractive mural to cover the work of the vandals. The square is the site each summer of the main items of the{GALA WEEK when funds are raised to support many of the community projects run by the { {Amenities Committee}through the year.
